lsystem Struct Reference

#include <ls.h>

Detailed Description

An L-System.

Definition at line 52 of file ls.h.

Data Fields

int angle
 The unit angle for this L-System. The angle is computed as 360/angle degrees.
double avgbbnodes [NUM_ORDER_TEST]
 The number of branch-and-bound nodes needed by CONCORDE to solve instances created by this L-System of various sizes.
int computed_f
 A boolean value indicating whether or not the fitness of this L-System has been calculated.
double f
 The fitness of this L-System.
int instancesize [NUM_ORDER_TEST]
 The size of each instance used for testing.
int numrules
 The number of rules in this L-System. It has to be at least two since the first one is the axiom.
ruleobj ** rule
 The set of rules.
int * rulelength
 The length of each rule (which is represented as a string) in this L-System.
double runningtimes [NUM_ORDER_TEST]
 The average time it takes for CONCORDE to solve instances created by this L-System of various sizes.
double sd [NUM_ORDER_TEST]
 The standard deviation of the set of running times.
char * startvar
 The name of each rule (ie. the start variable) - except the first (which is the axiom).

ruleobj** lsystem::rule

The set of rules.

It is an array of rules (which each is an array of ruleobj pointers) of size numrules. The first rule is the axiom.

Definition at line 66 of file ls.h.

Referenced by create_ls(), crossover_ls(), delete_ls(), getListOfFs(), print_ls(), random_rule(), readLSystem(), run(), and savetofile().
